verses.verse: My son<WH1121>, if thou art become surety<WH6148> for thy neighbor<WH7453>, If thou hast stricken<WH8628> thy hands<WH3709> for a stranger<WH2114>;
Thou art snared<WH3369> with the words<WH561> of thy mouth<WH6310>, Thou art taken<WH3920> with the words<WH561> of thy mouth<WH6310>.

Do <WH6213> this now<WH645>, my son<WH1121>, and deliver<WH5337> thyself<WH935>, Seeing thou art come into the hand<WH3709> of thy neighbor<WH7453>: Go<WH3212>, humble<WH7511> thyself<WH7292>, and importune thy neighbor<WH7453>;
Give <WH5414> not sleep<WH8142> to thine eyes<WH5869>, Nor slumber<WH8572> to thine eyelids<WH6079>;
Deliver <WH5337> thyself as a roe<WH6643> from the hand<WH3027> of the hunter<WH6833>, And as a bird from the hand<WH3027> of the fowler<WH3353>.
Go <WH3212> to the ant<WH5244>, thou sluggard<WH6102>; Consider<WH7200> her ways<WH1870>, and be wise<WH2449>:
Which having no chief<WH7101>, Overseer<WH7860>, or ruler<WH4910>,
Provideth <WH3559> her bread<WH3899> in the summer<WH7019>, And gathereth<WH103> her food<WH3978> in the harvest<WH7105>.
How long wilt thou sleep<WH7901>, O sluggard<WH6102>? When wilt thou arise<WH6965> out of thy sleep<WH8142>?
Yet a little<WH4592> sleep<WH8142>, a little<WH4592> slumber<WH8572>, A little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to sleep<WH7901>:
So shall thy poverty<WH7389> come<WH935> as a robber<WH1980>, And thy want<WH4270> as an armed<WH4043> man<WH376>.
A worthless<WH1100> person<WH120>, a man<WH376> of iniquity<WH205>, Is he that walketh<WH1980> with a perverse<WH6143> mouth<WH6310>;
That winketh<WH7169> with his eyes<WH5869>, that speaketh<WH4448> with his feet<WH7272>, That maketh<WH3384> signs with his fingers<WH676>;
In whose heart<WH3820> is perverseness<WH8419>, Who deviseth<WH2790> evil<WH7451> continually<WH6256>, Who soweth<WH7971> discord<WH4066>.
Therefore shall his calamity<WH343> come<WH935> suddenly<WH6597>; On a sudden<WH6621> shall he be broken<WH7665>, and that without remedy<WH4832>.
There are six<WH8337> things which Jehovah<WH3068> hateth<WH8130>; Yea<WH7651>, seven which are an abomination<WH8441> unto him<WH5315>:
Haughty <WH7311> eyes<WH5869>, a lying<WH8267> tongue<WH3956>, And hands<WH3027> that shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>;
A heart<WH3820> that deviseth<WH2790> wicked<WH205> purposes<WH4284>, Feet<WH7272> that are swift<WH4116> in running<WH7323> to mischief<WH7451>,
A false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> that uttereth<WH6315> lies<WH3577>, And he that soweth<WH7971> discord<WH4090> among brethren<WH251>.
My son<WH1121>, keep<WH5341> the commandment<WH4687> of thy father<WH1>, And forsake<WH5203> not the law<WH8451> of thy mother<WH517>:
Bind <WH7194> them continually<WH8548> upon thy heart<WH3820>; Tie<WH6029> them about thy neck<WH1621>.
When thou walkest<WH1980>, it shall lead<WH5148> thee<WH7901>; When thou sleepest, it shall watch<WH8104> over thee<WH6974>; And when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee<WH7878>.
For the commandment<WH4687> is a lamp<WH5216>; And the law<WH8451> is light<WH216>; And reproofs<WH8433> of instruction<WH4148> are the way<WH1870> of life<WH2416>:
To keep<WH8104> thee from the evil<WH7451> woman<WH802>, From the flattery<WH2513> of the foreigner<WH5237>'s tongue<WH3956>.
Lust <WH2530> not after her beauty<WH3308> in thy heart<WH3824>; Neither let her take<WH3947> thee with her eyelids<WH6079>.
For on account of<WH1157> a<WH802> harlot<WH2181> a man is brought to a piece<WH3603> of bread<WH3899>; And the adulteress<WH802> hunteth<WH6679> for the precious<WH3368> life<WH5315>.
Can a man<WH376> take<WH2846> fire<WH784> in his bosom<WH2436>, And his clothes<WH899> not be burned<WH8313>?
Or can one<WH376> walk<WH1980> upon hot coals<WH1513>, And his feet<WH7272> not be scorched<WH3554>?
So he that goeth in<WH935> to his neighbor<WH7453>'s wife<WH802>; Whosoever toucheth<WH5060> her shall not be unpunished<WH5352>.
Men do not despise<WH936> a thief<WH1590>, if he steal<WH1589> To satisfy<WH4390> himself<WH5315> when he is hungry<WH7456>:
But if he be found<WH4672>, he shall restore<WH7999> sevenfold<WH7659>; He shall give<WH5414> all the substance<WH1952> of his house<WH1004>.
He that committeth adultery<WH5003> with a woman<WH802> is void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820>: He doeth<WH6213> it who would destroy<WH7843> his own soul<WH5315>.
Wounds <WH5061> and dishonor<WH7036> shall he get<WH4672>; And his reproach<WH2781> shall not be wiped away<WH4229>.
For jealousy<WH7068> is the rage<WH2534> of a man<WH1397>; And he will not spare<WH2550> in the day<WH3117> of vengeance<WH5359>.
He will not regard<WH5375> any ransom<WH3724>; Neither will he rest content<WH14>, though thou givest many<WH7235> gifts<WH7810>.
